question: According to JAR OPS subpart K, when must the DFDR on a 12 seat turbo prop a/c begin recording?

choices.choice: From before the aircraft is capable of moving under its own power to after the a/c is no longer capable of moving under its own power
From lift off until the weight on wheels switch is made on landing
At commencement of the taxi to turning off the runway

explanation:
According to JAR OPS (Joint Aviation Requirements – Operations) Subpart K, the Digital Flight Data Recorder (DFDR) on an aircraft with a seating capacity of 12 or more seats, such as a turboprop, must begin recording as soon as the aircraft is capable of moving under its own power. This means that the DFDR should start recording from the moment the aircraft is powered on and can begin taxiing, before takeoff, and continue to record until the aircraft is no longer able to move under its own power (typically after landing and engine shutdown).

This is in accordance with the requirements for flight data recorders to capture important flight parameters during the operation of the aircraft for safety, monitoring, and investigative purposes.
